subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Jewish Influence Beyond Judaism
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Jewish Influence Beyond Judaism.

hook.text: Einstein, Freud, Marx, Kafka. Jewish thinkers shaped science, psychology, economics, and letters beyond their numbers.

buildup.text: Jews are 0.2% of the world but have won 22% of all Nobel Prizes. That ratio is astonishing.

discovery.text: The Talmudic tradition of argument and questioning built a culture that values debate, education, and intellectual risk.

twist.text: Anti-Semites twisted this success into conspiracy theories. Jewish achievement became fuel for hatred. A cruel irony.

climax.text: Jewish intellectual culture proves that a small group with a reverence for learning can reshape the entire world.

punchline.text: 0.2% of humanity, 22% of Nobel Prizes. Learning is Judaism's superpower.

quiz.question: What percentage of Nobel Prizes have been won by Jewish recipients?
